meanings.definition: To carry or drag something with difficulty or effort.
meanings.sent1: I had to schlepp my heavy suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She schlepped the bags of groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to schlepp his giant teddy bear across the room.
meanings.sent4: After a long day at work, he felt like he had to schlepp the weight of the world on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant continued to schlepp the food crumb back to its nest.

meanings.definition: A tedious or difficult journey or task.
meanings.sent1: The hike up the mountain was a real schlepp for the inexperienced climbers.
meanings.sent2: She considered the daily commute to work a real schlepp.
meanings.sent3: The endless paperwork on his desk felt like a never-ending schlepp.
meanings.sent4: The project turned out to be a real schlepp, taking much longer than expected.
meanings.sent5: The student groaned at the thought of the schlepp of studying for the final exam.
